meanings.definition: To extract oil or gas from a rock formation by injecting liquid at high pressure.
meanings.sent1: The workers fracked the ground to get the natural gas out.
meanings.sent2: The company fracked the rocks to release the oil trapped inside.
meanings.sent3: After a long day, the exhausted drill accidentally fracked the wrong spot!
meanings.sent4: The pressure of the situation felt like being fracked from all sides.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rocks being fracked echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: Used as a swear word or intensifier.
meanings.sent1: Fracked! I forgot my keys at home again.
meanings.sent2: She shouted 'Fracked!' when she realized she missed the bus.
meanings.sent3: Fracked! The cat knocked over the milk again.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm made him yell 'Fracked!' in frustration.
meanings.sent5: Fracked! That was a close call with the speeding car.
